intro: Ilex curtissii, commonly known as the Curtiss holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. These berries are an important food source for various birds and wildlife. Ilex curtissii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and moist, acidic soils.
